values: Bud had another fun day at the beach this weekend. He explored the old wreck & generally was in charge of the whole place (as usual! *g*)
Here's Bud enjoying a romp through the bluebell wood this morning!

Well, things seem to be progressing okay. *fc*
We've had a surveyor out to look at the bungalow for us & everything seems to be good.  There were a couple of issues - one with the chimney & a potential one with the drains that required us getting further reports done, but the results have come back with a positive (just some repair work to the chimney but nothing major.)  I'm really glad that we went ahead & got the surveys done (there was no legal requirement as we're not having a mortgage, but it's good for our peace of mind!)

We're going to view again tomorrow to finalise a few things with our vendors (they're doing some alterations for us in the utility/mud room) & also to measure up for curtains, etc.  It'll be nice to see inside the place again (I have been around & looked through the windows! *g*)

So, the legal side of things seems to be chugging along, & I hope we can hear something about the exchange of contracts soon. *fc*

In the meantime, we're doing a lot of decluttering & getting things sorted - donating things to charity, etc & getting ready to start packing stuff up.  It's amazing how virtually everything that we'd carefully stored away up in the loft has now been recycled/donated/thrown out! LOL

With that in mind, I have my John & Rodney action figures going free to a good home, if anyone would like them.  I'm just asking for the postage costs please.  (They seem to have lost their guns, etc & are not boxed - they've spent all of their time wrapped around each other kissing!)

In other news - no Supernatural to share this week, I'm afraid. :(

Hope everyone has a great weekend!
*hugs*

Despite being rather busy with the move (so much paperwork!) I've managed to find the time for a couple of sewing projects. (I find sewing very therapeutic! *g*) I'm exploring the world of applique - & really loving it!  I'm still very new to it & just finding my way, but here are a couple of appliqued cushions: Labrador & love-hearts! Home I love this swallow fabric & thought it went well with the 'home' theme - like birds flying home. :)

Last week, Bud & I represented Labrador Rescue South East & Central at Crufts! We helped out on the LRSEC stand - raising awareness of the charity & getting donations. Bud was an absolute star & people loved him! There were several offers to take him home - I had to explain that he was my dog & if they wanted to adopt him, they'd have to adopt me, too! *g* It was a really lovely day, & I was so proud of my silly boy . We had six happy-ending rescue dogs on the stand (including Bud) & there were people coming around all day long. It was so busy that apart from giving Bud a couple of comfort breaks, we worked the stand all day. So, I didn't get to do any shopping at any of the great doggie-related stalls or to see any of the events going on.  Never mind - I had so much fun talking about Bud all day! It was rather tiring though, & when we got home, we both flaked out! *g* I never thought that I'd be able to say that Buddy had been to Crufts! *g* Ambassador Buddy!

We had another fabulous day at the beach with Buddy last weekend. We went down to Somerset to Brean & played on the beach & then climbed up to Brean Down & walked along to the old fort at the end. It was a cold but beautifully sunny day.

Woohoo!  After several months of looking (& getting fairly disheartened) we've finally found a really lovely bungalow & they've accepted our offer!
The legal wheels are now in motion (we got a huge pile of documents to read, fill in & return this morning) & hopefully things will run fairly smoothly & we should be moving in a couple of months. *fc*

The property is being flipped by a developer, & so everything has been refurbished - new wiring, plaster, windows, doors, bathroom, kitchen, boiler, central heating - it's like a brand new home. I'm actually so relieved as I really didn't fancy taking on any big reno projects. *g*
It's in a really pretty village that is a little farther out into the countryside than where we are now, & there are lots of lovely walks for us to explore with Bud.  We really love where we live now, & so it had to be the 'right' place to tempt us to leave.  And being on one level means no more stairs for Bud to climb! Yay!

I know that nothing is definite until the contracts are exchanged, etc, but I'm so happy about this! \o/

A couple of people asked to see my new skirt when I'd finished making it, so here it is. I think that the fabric is just so cute! I made a couple of adjustments to the pattern - I used an invisible zip instead of a normal one as I think it gives a much smoother silhouette, plus it just seems a bit more professsional looking.  I also added a lining - using a pale blue silky lining fabric -  so that it didn't stick to my tights as I walked. *g* It was the sweet & beautiful 's birthday over the weekend, & we went out for a lovely afternoon tea at our local vineyard, giving me a chance to wear my new skirt!  In fact, it was a fabulous weekend all around as the wonderful had come up to visit & so there was much chatting & laughter!

It was half term last week, & we took Bud to Wales & the beach for the day. We had such a wonderful time. It was cold but beautifully sunny. Perfect! I absolutely love this pic!  Once we're in our new home, I'm going to get this made into a big canvas print for the wall. Watcha doin'? Me & my boy! Bud's had enough of the paparazzi! *g* Another fabulous day making happy memories with my two boys!

I've recently been working on a really fun project - making a set of Gryffindor robes for ! I found a post with an outline of how to go about it - but it was more a set of diary notes than a step-by-step tutorial.  I had to adapt an existing cloak pattern - reshaping the hood & sleeves & giving it a full lining (with the sleeves, hood & facings in the appropriate Gryffindor red.)  It took some figuring out, but I'm quite pleased (actually - pretty darn pleased) with the result! *g* I had to add my 'Made with love - Chez Buddy' label, of course! I bought a Gryffindor patch & sewed it on. The hood is quite long & comes to a very satisfying point! My current project is a sweet, little skirt for myself made with this very cute Scottie dog print! ♥

Fandom has lost another truly spectacular individual. The wonderful & unique Zen - <lj user="vagabondage" /> - has gone, leaving the world a less vibrant & kickass place.

We met online nearly twenty years ago in Highlander fandom. We had crazy, fantastic times in the RSM (Renegade Slash Militia) & I'm so happy that we actually got to meet in person a couple of times, too.

She was an amazing person & I'm going to miss her. 
I won't say sleep well - I know that she's already tearing the place up & having fun.

Bud & I took my mom down to Berrow beach yesterday for a lovely (but very blustery!) walk. There's an old wreck there that you can walk out to at low tide. It was a Norwegian boat - the SS Nornen - that sunk in 1897. Fortunately, the 10 crew - & their dog! - were rescued by the local lifeboat! (More historical info can be found here.) Explorer!Bud on a mission!

We've sold our house! Well, it's all subject to contract, blah, bah, blah but the sold board will be going on asap! I'm trying not to get too excited as I know that things can still fall through - nothing's definite until the contracts are exchanged - but it feels good not to have to be doing anymore showings. (I've never done so much housework in my life! *g*) So, now we just have to find a place. We've made it clear to our buyers that we won't move until we find somewhere & they're okay with that. (They want our house so much that they're willing to move into rented accomodation if their buyer pushes to move quickly.) So, come on universe - throw some lovely properties our way please! :) Gratuitous pic of Bud with cute pawprints that has nothing to do with moving house! *g*

We took Bud to the beach again this weekend - this time to Barmouth in Wales. It was a glorious, big, sandy beach & we all had a fabulous time. I love us spending time as a family like this. Bud found a ball & we played a bit of footie... Until he just picked it up & ran off with it! *g* ♥

It was so cold walking through the fields this morning that frost formed on Bud's whiskers, eyebrows & ears!
It was all very beautiful though with a heavy hoar frost turning everything to white lace. (Bud was already beautiful, of course! *g*)

Back home now to a nice hot cup of tea!

On Saturday, we had a lovely day out in Llangollen, Wales (we're lucky that it's only about an hour & 15 min drive from home.) We had a little mooch around the town & then climbed up (& up!) to the ruined 13th Century castle that overlooks the town & the Dee Valley. We've visited before, but this time there was snow up on the hills! It was gorgeous. Castell Dinas Bran translates to 'Castle of the City of Crows' & is very atmospheric. Me & my boy! The cloud was so low lying that we were up above it! Me & the Budster leading the way! *g* Bud posing for the camera!
A few more pics from Bud's most recent beach adventure... I love my boy so much! ♥
We had a glorious day on the beach over the holidays. It was so peaceful & perfect - definitely food for the soul. Me & my boy. ♥

Hi all & a very happy New Year!
*hugs*

<lj-cut text="a quick update on me">

I know that I'm rather late with the New Year greetings, but things have been so busy here.
We're still in the same position house-wise as before - we've accepted an offer on our house but the lady is still to sell her own. That means that we're still on the market & so are having other people come around for viewings. We had 5 over the weekend & already there are 2 more booked in for tomorrow.  I just find having people coming to see the house a bit stressful. Plus, I'm rather OCD & the levels of cleaning are getting astronomical!  We did actually have one couple comment that they'd never seen such a clean house in their lives!
We still haven't found the right property to move to. The one that we did make an offer on (which was accepted) we then lost because someone else came along & they were all ready to go as they were sold.  So, we're keeping on looking.
I'm sure the right house is out there & that things will work out for the best in the end. :)

Also, I've been getting a bit bogged down inside my head & retreating from the world for a while, & I really need to tackle that.  It's a warning sign & I don't want to start backsliding into depression again.  I really need to interact on LJ more & start to feel some fandom joy.  And with that in mind, <lj user="lantean_drift" /> & KB are coming around tonight for pizza & a rewatch of The Abominable Bride. Awesome!</lj-cut>

I hope that 2016 is treating everyone well so far & that you're all healthy & happy!
It's getting down to the wire but I'm finally ready for Christmas! Here's wishing a very happy holidays to one & all! *hugs*
Me, flying over Hogwarts! And totally not fazed by the Dark Mark - us Hufflepuffs are made of sterner stuff! *g* Best. Day. Ever!

Happy birthday to the lovely <lj user="gloria1" /> &<lj user="xanthe" />!
*hugs*

Fandom has lost a colourful, sweet soul today.
Rest well, <lj user="moonlightmead"/>.

As promised, here are a few pics from my fabulous birthday surprise visit to 'The Making of Harry Potter' in Leavesden. \o/ Firstly, I was picked up by the Hogwarts Express!  Complete with owl on the dash & the stereo blaring out 'Something wicked this way comes'! *g* And then I was whisked away to Hogwarts for a day of fun, laughter & shenanigans! As it was my birthday (I had an official HP birthday badge! *g*), I got to help open the huge doors into the Great Hall. It was so exciting.  The hall was decorated for a Halloween feast & looked amazing. Here's me & my wand - ready for anything. *g* (Note my Harry glasses!  made us all goodie bags which included a pair!) Good job I was ready - look who we bumped into: a Death Eater! I was being my usual Hufflepuff-nice self & then she challenged me!  So, what could I do? Okay, & then I sort of ran away! LOL We rode brooms in the green screen area ( has my pic from there, I'll post it when I get a copy!) & flew in the Weasley's Ford Anglia (I got to drive 'cus I was the birthday girl! *g*)  Next we went to Platform 9 & 3/4! I got my very own Fang & he accompanied us on the rest of the tour. We rode on the Knight Bus... ... drank butter beer... ... visited Diagon Alley... ... and finally got to Hogwarts! ♥ What a fabulous, amazing, awesome day. I have the sweethest, kindest, most thoughtful friends in the world! ♥ Thank you , , , & KB (& also & J who couldn't be with us.) xxx

Best. Day. Ever.
Will post pics & details when I've recovered! *g*

It's my birthday on Saturday & earlier in the week, I got quite a surprise: I received my Hogwarts letter! Beautifully typed on headed note paper & sealed with a Hogwarts wax seal, too. Over the next few days, I also received (all via owl - well, they just appeared in the house! *g*) a howler reminder, my house information & shirt (Pottormore sorted me into Hufflepuff) & finally the details of the adventure. So, tomorrow, , , , & KB will be escorting me to the Warner Brothers' Studio Tour in Leavesden for a day of squeeing over everything Harry Potter! \o/ I am so excited, & also so very grateful - I have the sweetest, kindest, most generous friends. (And Mr B, too - who I think may have 'helped' the owl deliver my letters!)

Wow!  Things have been happening very fast!
We've viewed a bungalow that we really like & have had an offered accepted - on the proviso that it's kept on the market until we have a buyer.
So, our house went 'live' on Thurs afternoon.  We had one viewing last night & four planned for this morning!
Let's hope that at least one likes it enough to make a sensible offer. *fc*

Well, we've chosen an agent & they came yesterday to take photos & measure up for the brochure.
Hopefully, we should be live on the market by the weekend!
One very nice side effect is that the house is absolutely sparkling! *g* I mean, I am kind of a neat freak anyway, but now the place is completely pristine! LOL

We've viewed a few places - one of which we're very interested in. I have to ring today to get a few things clarified &, if all is well, we may actually put in an offer! *fc*

We had our first valuation for the house last night.  It went really well, & I was very impressed with the estate agent.  I'd got lots of questions to ask (after much internet research! *g*) & she was very competent & answered everything.
She also liked Bud (they have a golden & so she's used to big silly dogs!) which counts for a LOT in my world!
They're a local, independent firm who have been around for years, & I really felt that they would look after us.

We have the second valuation this evening, & the final one on Friday.  Then we'll make a decision, although I am leaning towards Amie so far. :)

I've been rather scare lately as I've been busy decorating. (Bud's been 'helping' too - i.e. getting covered in paint!) We're putting our house on the market, & I just wanted to spruce it up a bit. We've lived here for twenty years & it's a lovely home, & in one way I'll be sad to leave (oh, my gorgeous new kitchen & bathroom!)  But we've decided that we need to move to a bungalow.  Bud's nearly ten now, & despite being fighting fit, I do worry that he may eventually have trouble with the stairs.  This happened with Rascal in the last year or so, but as he slept downstairs, he didn't mind.  But Buddy sleeps upstairs (in our room) & I know that he'd be very distressed if he couldn't climb the stairs.  So, we're going to move to a single story home - hopefully it'll be our final home & so it's future-proofing us for old age, too! *g* So, better go & finish painting the fence! (Aaagh - we have a huge garden & so much fence! *g*) In the meantime, here's my very sprightly 'golden oldie'!

No it's SuperBud! *g* On Sunday, we went to the annual Dogs' Party for the Lab rescue who brought us our beautiful Bud. We had such a great time! So many gorgeous Labs to meet & snuggle, a fun dog show, stalls with so much doggy-themed stuff, bbq, cakes, & even some sunshine! What a lovely day. Bud entered 4 categories in the fun show & won 3 rosettes! We came first in the sausage & spoon race! (& Bud got to eat the sausage at the end), 5th in the 'most handsome dog' & 5th in the fancy dress!  (I made Bud's costume & was pretty pleased that it stood up well against the store bought ones.) First place! \o/ Showing off his rosettes! Another lovely day making memories... ♥
has made a great little vid to the Spn s10 gag reel. It made me smile so much! Roll on Oct 7th!
I miss zipping through the swamps spotting gators! *g* Photos courtesy of Mr B who is a bit of a whizz with a camera!

My standmixer has just broken down. It's less than a year old but the guarantee says that you need the original box to return it.
Who keeps the box?!

I'm home from a fabulous holiday in the US deep south. We road-tripped through Georgia, Alabama, Mississippi & down to New Orleans.  Lots of Civil War battlefields & museums, a little hiking, a lovely trip on a paddlesteamer & zooming through the bayous on an airboat spotting 'gators! Woohoo! Tremendous fun. We also visited the ruins of an antebellum plantation house that had been destroyed by fire in the 1890s.  Only the huge, intricate pillars remain.  It was so atmospheric. We loved it. Windsor Ruins, nr. Rodney, Mississippi: Hope everyone is well & happy! *hugs*

posted a link to this very cute clip from the season 6 opener of H-5O & I had to share. Steve & Danny dancing together (It's on Instagram & I don't know how to embed from there.) I'm not in the fandom anymore, & the show does often annoy me (though I still keep watching!) but this reminds me of why I fell in love with these two back in season 1. *g*

Hulloo! LJ keeps dumping me out & then not letting me log back in (claims it doesn't recognise my name or password!) So, while I am actually logged in (not sure why it let me in this time) I wanted to share my latest sewing project. It's a 50's inspired halter dress which I do rather love.  I chose a retro looking fabric & am so happy with the way it turned out (despite me having to put the zip in about 5 times! LOL) I'm taking my Mom out for a formal afternoon tea at our local stately home next month, & so I think that I'll wear it then. (I have a lovely little white shrug that looks perfect with it!)
...so, here's Bud wearing a tiara! *g* Poor boy - putting up with his mom's silliness! ♥ (This pic was taken in honour of the very lovely & amazing . ♥)

<lj-embed id="195"/>
I love this so much! \o/

<lj-embed id="193" />

'I had to grow this moustache just so people would recognise me.'

*squee to infinity*
\o/
*flail*

I finally managed to write my story for my annual writing weekend in Sept! (I sent it in with 5 hours to spare! LOL) I wrote the first draft last week while Bud & I had a super week by the sea with various lovely friends including , , , & . We hired a beautiful house in Southwold, only 5 mins walk from the beach. It was smashing & so relaxing. While there, I shocked by mentioning that I'd never read any Harry Potter (& I've only seen the first 2 films. *g*)  Being the only non-Potter person there, I decided to give The Philosopher's Stone a go... I'm now halfway through The Order of the Phoenix!!  I'm absolutely loving them! Here are a few of pics of Bud enjoying his holibobs. ♥ Auntie & Auntie bought him the Biggest Tennis Ball in the World! (Bud does love tennis balls! *g*)

The lovely <lj user="danceswithgary" /> has tagged me in the seven lines meme, & I'm so sorry DWG but I don't have a WIP that I can go to. :( 
I haven't written anything in age - although I must write something very soon (i.e. for an end of June deadline!!!) to submit for the annual writing weekend that I go to every September. (It's just not as much fun attending, if I haven't submitted a story.)
I haven't had chance to watch the finale of Spn yet... but. This!!! ♥ How amazing is this?! \o/

<lj-cut text="Spoilers - vague but still spoilery">Oh my goodness - the angst!
This week's ep was sooo good, but I'm in pieces emotionally.
Please, Show, fix it in the finale & don't leave us with a huge, aching cliffhanger! (Faint hope, I know!)</lj-cut>
Saw this over at 's & it just made me smile so much. So nice that the lads are still friends after all these years. *happy sigh*

On Tuesday, <lj user="xanthe" /> & I went to see Take That in concert at the NEC Arena.
ZOMG! They were incredible! Absolutely fabulous - what a spectacular show.
We sang, danced, cheered, shouted & screamed all night long! LOL
I'm now rather hoarse & very tired (must be getting a bit old for such late night shennanagins *g*) but it was totally worth it!

<lj-cut text="spoilers">OMG!
I can't believe they killed Charlie!
I loved her so much.
These last few eps have been amazing, & the tension's mounting but did they have to do this? *sob* 
We've lost so many over the years...
*still not over Bobby*</lj-cut>
